google_reviews.author: Dana Carlson
google_reviews.review: Morgan, the property manager has been great! Very responsive, explaining everything clearly, professional and helpful. My neighbors have been amazing as well. Friendly and introduced themselves. People always walking dogs. Nice atmosphere!

google_reviews.author: Wendy Tung
google_reviews.review:
Firstly, the property manager Morgan is amazing. I was thrown off by some of the reviews for the previous property manager... but Morgan is CHEFS KISS fantastic. She's responsive, personable, and goes above and beyond if you encounter any issues. Just the best person to deal with.

My cat and I moved here when I needed to downsize. The 1br/1bth is small, but I've made it work. You'll definitely need to buy furniture that doubles as storage as storage space is very limited. Neighbors are very respectful about the parking spaces and everyone parks in the same spots... so you're never struggling trying to find parking.

I would recommend purchasing a dehumidifier to use during the spring/summer months to kick the moisture issue.

If you're looking for a fancy place... this isn't it. But it's comfortable and I've made it cozy. So there's that!

google_reviews.author: Brian Kirst
google_reviews.review:
New manager Morgan is amazing. All previous reviews were due to bad manager previous to Morgan. Trust me! I lived here for three years. Former manager Charlene was not a great fit for the apartments. She was very difficult and not a great charmer.
Look, this place isnt perfect. If you are looking for basic, no thrills, no special treatment. This is your place. Pay your rent on time, follow the rules and communicate with Morgan, she is great. If you do this, this place will be a good home.

google_reviews.author: Kelsey
google_reviews.review:
Moldy, cheap, slow response to repair requests, and worst of all: property manager is neurotic and one of the strangest and most aggressive people I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with.
She seems to have little to no supervision and does what she wants. She will not send you statements or receipts for anything you pay for. She will not mail you your security deposit. She will not share the owners contact information because she does not want to be in trouble. As soon as you ask for proof of anything, for information, or for any updates about repairs or charges or anything -  she will shut down and be completely uncooperative and combative.

She will enter your apartment unannounced and while you are not home. She will walk around the back of the properties and peep through windows if you leave the curtains open.

You wont get your money back and she wont return calls from new landlords checking on rental history. Her office is like a black hole where your receipts, money, and paperwork disappear. Just avoid this place.

summary.text:
Good

The Village Apartments seem to shine under new management, according to recent user reviews. Several tenants have posited positive experiences with the current property manager named Morgan, highlighting traits like responsiveness, helpfulness, and a respectful attitude towards tenants and pets. The change in management has evidently brought about a positive shift in the living experience at Village Apartments, with the property manager being described as "CHEFS KISS fantastic" and praised for going "above and beyond" for residents.

Moreover, the accommodating nature of the community is often cited, with neighbors introducing themselves and creating a friendly atmosphere. Some residents appreciate the simple pleasures of the property, such as the cleanliness and affordability of the laundry facilities, and the quietness of the location. In spite of some limitations, the residents appear to have cultivated a comfortable living situation with their fellow neighbors.

Great

Commendably, the Village Apartments have been recognized for their exemplary department management under Morgan's supervision. Positive testimonials abound, describing her as "amazing" and noting that she exhibits professionalism in her interactions with residents. These sentiments reflect a complete turnaround from previous criticisms, indicating that management responsiveness and tenant relations have significantly improved. Additionally, the new manager’s affection for pets has not gone unnoticed, which can be quite a draw for pet owners looking to rent.

Mention of the amenities, albeit minimal, suggests that residents find certain aspects like parking arrangements satisfactory, highlighting that neighbors are respectful of assigned spaces. Such comments suggest that while the apartments may not be luxurious, they provide a solid, no-frills living experience for those with realistic expectations and a cooperative spirit.

Bad

However, not all user reviews are as positive, with some former tenants expressing discontent with various facets of Village Apartments. Issues cited include a perceived delay in addressing repair requests, with repeated follow-ups needed to resolve maintenance issues. Some reviews also describe encounters with rudeness from the management and a lack of professionalism, particularly prior to the tenure of the new property manager.

Another concern noted in user reviews is financial management, especially regarding the return of security deposits. Visitors found communication regarding financial transactions lacking, with receipts and detailed statements not being provided as expected. Such experiences, as narrated by tenants, have understandably contributed to a cautionary sentiment towards potential renters.

Ugly

The most severe criticisms of Village Apartments revolve around severe allegations of unprofessionalism and invasion of privacy. One alarming review describes the property manager entering apartments unannounced and allegedly peeping through windows. Moreover, claims of mismanagement of funds, particularly concerning security deposits, have been a significant source of distress for some former residents. The unsettling experiences shared by past tenants, including alleged discrimination and harassment, cast a shadow over the property's management practices that could be concerning for prospective renters.

In summary, while the Village Apartments have shown signs of improvement under new management, it is evident from past user reviews that there have been serious allegations of misconduct and mismanagement. Despite the positive changes, these grave concerns call for a cautious approach and careful consideration for those contemplating tenancy at Village Apartments.
